alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Knox; Marion; Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 15 at 9:30PM EST until February 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Knox, Marion and Morrow. In northeast Ohio, Holmes. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warmer temperatures and gusty winds will cause the snowpack across the area to begin quickly melting on Wednesday. In addition, a system will bring 1 to 2 inches of rain across the region late Wednesday night through Thursday evening. The combination of rainfall and rapid snow melt will cause significant rises on area streams, creeks, and rivers, with some waterways likely to exceed flood stage. Ice jams may also develop on frozen waterways and could become focus areas for flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
